business.headline: Warner Bros Discovery signs $110 billion deal with Paramount SkydanceWarner Bros Discovery agreed to a $110 billion acquisition by Paramount Skydance after Netflix declined to match the offer, creating a media powerhouse set to reshape Hollywood and streaming competition.

From FDs to mutual funds: How Indians are changing their investment behaviourFor years, FDs and real estate were the first choice for Indian savers seeking safety and certainty. Now, mutual funds are steadily gaining popularity, especially among first-time investors looking for higher returns. Is this the beginning of a long-term shift in how Indians invest?

India's Q3 GDP grows 7.8% as government rolls out new base year seriesThe Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation introduced a new series of GDP estimates with 2022-23 as the base year, replacing the earlier 2011-12 base.

Sensex, Nifty fall over 1% as global worries mount; auto, financial shares tankThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.

Pakistan to run short of flour? Wheat output likely to fall amid Afghanistan warAccording to a report by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA), Pakistan's wheat production is expected to decline by 2 to 2.2 million tonnes compared to last year.

Including property in your will? Here's how to avoid family and legal conflictsA house is often the most valuable thing people leave behind. Yet, without proper details in a Will, like ownership clarity, liabilities, and documentation, it can become the very reason families face delays and disagreements instead of closure. Is your Will detailed enough to prevent that?

Why India's growing wealth is driving investment into luxury real estateAs capital increases, investors become more careful. The focus shifts from chasing returns to protecting value. This is why luxury real estate is gaining importance in serious portfolios.

Silver jumps over Rs 8,000: Time to invest, hold or sell?Silver shot up by over Rs 8,000, marking a fresh high in recent trading. With momentum high but volatility looming, the big question is: is it time to invest or sell?

What are Life Cycle Funds and how can they make your retirement planning easier?Life cycle funds are designed to adjust their asset allocation automatically as an investor moves closer to a specific goal, usually retirement.

Sensex closes 961 points lower: Why stock market fell todayThe S&P BSE Sensex tanked 961.42 points to close at 81,287.19, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 317.90 points to end at 25,178.65.  Both indices lost over 1%.

Block's 4,000 job cuts: Why layoffs are no longer a sign of crisisBlock said it would cut more than 4,000 jobs, nearly half its workforce, reducing staff from over 10,000 to just under 6,000. This was not a company in distress. It was a company growing.
Sensex opens 277 points lower, Nifty below 25,400; Infosys up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 389.29 points to 81,866.32, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 154.55 points to 25,342.00 as of 9:50 am.

Rs 583 crore returned, full-page ads out – is IDFC First Bank's trust push enough?IDFC First Bank's response offers a rare test of corporate accountability. But will a quick refund and bold messaging be enough to turn a damaging crisis into a chance to rebuild trust? We spoke to experts to understand what real recovery will demand.

Netflix calls Warner deal not attractive, clears path for ParamountNetflix declined to raise its bid for Warner Bros. Discovery, clearing the way for Paramount's $31-per-share takeover offer that could reshape Hollywood and trigger major antitrust scrutiny.

Earning Rs 30 lakh a year but little wealth? Why many DINK couples fall behindWith two salaries and no childcare costs, DINK couples are often seen as having a clear financial advantage. Yet many high-earning couples find their wealth growing slower than expected. Is lifestyle inflation quietly eroding their investment potential?

India, Israel sign MoU to link UPI systems, boost digital payment tiesThe integration is expected to help Indian and Israeli businesses and individuals carry out financial transactions more easily. It could also reduce transaction costs and processing time, making payments faster and more convenient.

World Economic Forum chief Borge Brende quits amid probe into Epstein tiesBorge Brende, President and CEO of the World Economic Forum, has stepped down amid scrutiny over his past interactions with Jeffrey Epstein.
Sensex and Nifty erase early gains to end flat over global uncertaintyThe S&P BSE Sensex lost 27.46 points to close at 82,248.61, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 14.05 points to end at 25,496.55.

MeitY Secretary S Krishnan says social media must work within constitutional limitsS Krishnan defended the government's approach to regulating digital platforms. He said the Ministry's actions are firmly rooted in the Constitution and follow due legal process.

Gold jumped 72% and silver soared 122% last year. Can 2026 deliver the same rally?Gold and silver may not climb the way they did in 2025, but the base remains firm. This year calls for clear judgement, realistic expectations and a focus on long-term signals.

entertainment.headline: Alia Bhatt addresses BAFTA red carpet backlash: Is it because of my expression? Alia Bhatt has addressed the online criticism over her BAFTA red carpet interview, clarifying her reaction to a question about a film plot twist.

Benny Blanco reacts to viral dirty feet backlash, shows off clean bare foot Benny Blanco addressed the viral "dirty feet" controversy from his podcast during a recent interview. He clarified that the floors were to blame, not his hygiene.

India's finest stories are waiting. Why won't Bollywood book new scripts? Why is Bollywood not adapting more from India's rich literary canon? This week's Cinematic Saturday explores the gap that continues to exist between books and cinema in Hindi, and how the film industry may be ignoring some of India's greatest tales.

Sankalp teaser: Nana Patekar makes OTT debut in Prakash Jha's socio-political saga Filmmaker Prakash Jha's upcoming series Sankalp marks Nana Patekar's OTT debut and explores themes of power, ideology and control. The show will stream for free on Amazon MX Player, with the release date yet to be announced.

Ektaa Kapoor issues alert on fake casting scam in Balaji's name. Read statement Ektaa Kapoor's production house, Balaji Telefilms, issued a statement that all casting for the banner is managed through its official channels. They urged the public not to pay for auditions or share personal data with unverified sources.

Black, bold, Bhatt: Alia rocks Gucci's Primavera show. See pics Alia Bhatt appeared at Milan Fashion Week dressed in an all-black ensemble for Gucci's debut runway under new creative director Demna Gvasalia. Several pictures of the actor from the global event have gone viral.

Ranabaali: Rashmika-Vijay's big surprise after wedding coming up on February 28 Even as their wedding continues to make news, Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda get set to unveil a major surprise about their upcoming film Ranabaali on February 28.

The Kerala Story 2 producer Vipul Shah reacts as High Court clears film's release Vipul Shah welcomed the Kerala High Court's decision to lift the interim stay on The Kerala Story 2: Goes Beyond. The order was passed by a division bench comprising Justices SA Dharmadhikari and PV Balakrishnan.

Who is Sangeetha Sornalingam? Actor Vijay's wife files for divorce after 27 years Sangeetha Sornalingam, wife of Tamil actor and TVK chief Vijay, has filed for divorce in the Chengalpattu family court, alleging her husband's involvement in an extramarital affair. The couple, married since 1999, has two children together.

Prakash Raj exits Prabhas and Sandeep Reddy Vanga's Spirit: Report Actor Prakash Raj has reportedly exited Sandeep Reddy Vanga's upcoming film Spirit, starring Prabhas. The update came as the team welcomed Vivek Oberoi as part of the cast.

Vishnu Vinyasam review: Sree Vishnu's film is a painful collection of unfunny reelsRelease Date:Fri Feb 27, 2026 Vishnu Vinyasam movie review: Director Yadunaath Maruthi Rao's Vishnu Vinyasam, starring Sree Vishnu and Nayan Sarika, is a painfully unfunny film. The film draws inspiration from many social media trends, but has zero impact.

Sriram Raghavan addresses Ikkis backlash; says those objecting haven't seen the film Sriram Raghavan admitted that he was baffled at the first reactions to his war-drama Ikkis. He said that those who have objected haven't even seen the film.

Dipika Kakar in pain after cyst surgery, shares health update in new vlog Actor Dipika Kakar has undergone a second liver surgery after being diagnosed with a malignant tumour last year. Her husband, Shoaib Ibrahim, confirmed the success of the procedure and provided an update on her current health.

Zubeen Garg honoured posthumously with 3 Filmfare Awards for contribution to music Iconic singer Zubeen Garg was honoured at the Filmfare Awards Assamese 2026 in Guwahati with a heartfelt tribute. The late artist received three posthumous awards, recognising his enduring contribution to music and Assamese cinema.

2017 Kerala actor assault case: State government challenges Dileep's acquittal The Kerala government has filed an appeal in the High Court challenging the acquittal of actor Dileep and three others. The state also sought stronger sentences for those already convicted in the 2017 actor assault case.

Boong set for release. Check date when BAFTA-winning film arrives in theatres Farhan Akhtar announced the theatrical release date of his BAFTA-winning Manipuri film Boong. The Lakshmipriya Devi directorial won the award in Best Children's and Family Film category.

Spirit: Vivek Oberoi joins Sandeep Reddy Vanga's dark world. See poster Sandeep Reddy Vanga has added Vivek Oberoi to the cast of his upcoming film, Spirit. The actor's first-look poster screams raw intensity and quiet menace.

Karan Johar calls artists 'nobodies', says loyalty is myth in Bollywood Karan Johar opened up about actors' "insecurities" and lack of loyalty in Bollywood. He called talent management a "thankless job" amid reports of Janhvi Kapoor exiting his agency.

Deadline review: BLACKPINK still know how to chant their way into your head BLACKPINK made a confident return with Deadline, delivering a sleek, global sound driven by strong English lyrics and personal touches. Balancing bold anthems with softer moments, the mini-album reinforced their place at the top of modern pop.

general news.headline: Great leaders: Trump praises Shehbaz Sharif, Asim Munir amid Pak-Afghanistan warUS President Donald Trump signalled openness to intervention in the Pakistan-Afghanistan war, but highlighted his strong relationship with Islamabad amid escalating cross-border tensions.

OpenAI reaches key deal with US Department of War amid Trump-Anthropic falloutOpenAI signed a deal with the Department of War to deploy its AI models on the department's classified networks, the firm's CEO Sam Altman said. The agreement comes amid rising tensions between the Pentagon and rival AI firm Anthropic over the military use of AI.

Pakistan still have an outside chance of reaching the T20 World Cup semisT20 World Cup Pakistan's semi final qualification scenario: England's four-wicket victory over New Zealand has kept Pakistan's semi-final hopes alive in the tournament. Here's the complete explanation of what Pakistan need to do to progress ahead in the event:

Odisha woman raped by boyfriend during elopement plan, later killed by strangerThe woman was first raped by her boyfriend, who later abandoned her. She was then taken by a stranger to another location, where he raped her and pushed her from the fourth floor.

India's finest stories are waiting. Why won't Bollywood book new scripts?Why is Bollywood not adapting more from India's rich literary canon? This week's Cinematic Saturday explores the gap that continues to exist between books and cinema in Hindi, and how the film industry may be ignoring some of India's greatest tales.

We don't need it: Trump orders federal agencies to stop using AnthropicUS President Donald Trump accused Anthropic of trying to dictate military policy and endangering national security, warning of possible civil and criminal consequences, while setting a six-month transition period for affected agencies.

AI is no longer a technology story. It's an evolving human storyArtificial intelligence is no longer a speculative technology story. It is now a macro story playing out in the real world. And the world's sharpest minds cannot agree on what happens next: gloom or bloom?

Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu reveals list of 10 jobs that are safe from AI and pay wellZoho founder Sridhar Vembu says the AI era will force societies to rethink work, value, and purpose, with human-centred roles staying relevant even as machines take over productivity.

No IIT, no IIM: Why your course may matter more in 2026Handcrafted ByOur Editors As artificial intelligence redraws career paths and disrupts traditional job roles, India's long-standing obsession with elite college tags is facing its first serious test. In an AI-driven economy, the value of what students learn is increasingly challenging the prestige of where they study.
Live: Paper review, expert analysis at 1:30 PMCBSE Chemistry Board Exam 2026 Live Updates: More than 25 lakh students are appearing for the Class 12 Chemistry board exam today.

West Indies return to hallowed Eden hoping to conjure Calypso magic vs IndiaIND vs WI, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: West Indies are set to play India in a virtual quarter-final in the T20 World Cup 2026. Despite being the favourites, India should not make the mistake of counting out the West Indies.

The empty leash: The K9 dog soldiers who took bullets firstFrom counter-terror operations in Jammu and Kashmir to high-risk search missions across India, the dogs of the Indian military and paramilitary have always taken the lead, and have often paid with their lives while protecting the soldiers they serve beside. This write-up is a reminder of the wars they have fought for us.

Exclusive: What went behind making Rashmika-Vijay's heavy gold wedding jewelleryHint: It took over 10 months to craft Rashmika Mandanna and Vijay Deverakonda's wedding jewellery, and the couple was deeply involved in the process.

15 dead after Bolivian Air Force plane carrying new banknotes crashes on busy roadA Bolivian Air Force Hercules plane, carrying newly-printed banknotes, crashed onto a busy road near the capital La Paz amid bad weather, severely damaging vehicles.

Actor and TVK chief Vijay's wife files for divorce, alleges affair with actorActor and TVK chief Vijay's wife, Sangeetha, has filed for divorce. She has accused Vijay of infidelity, alleging that he was involved in an extramarital relationship with a fellow actor.

3 Bishnoi gang shooters fire at Haryana supplements shop, attack caught on cameraThree armed men linked to the Lawrence Bishnoi gang opened fire at a supplements store in Haryana's Sonipat. Police suspect the shooting as a case of gang rivalry and identified two shooters based on the CCTV footage.

AI is killing the single-job era: Moonlighting goes mainstreamSide hustles, reels, freelancing and podcasts: professionals are no longer relying on just one career stream. Why must you read this article? Because parallel careers are fast becoming the new workplace reality
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Benny Blanco reacts to viral dirty feet backlash, shows off clean bare footBenny Blanco addressed the viral "dirty feet" controversy from his podcast during a recent interview. He clarified that the floors were to blame, not his hygiene.

Indore university expels female student over objectionable acts in hostelThe university ordered an enquiry after complaints surfaced, following which authorities said her continued stay could disrupt the hostel environment.
Vijay Deverakonda and the return of the regal Indian groomOne thing most will agree, Vijay Deverakonda set a bar for upcoming grooms this year, no?

I'm hungry, tired to dictate: Allahabad High Court judge reserves judgmentThe incident occurred on February 24, when Justice Subhash Vidyarthi of the high court's Lucknow bench passed the order on a plea filed by Chandralekha Singh.
2 killed after tram veers off track, crashes into shop in MilanTwo people were killed and around 40 others were injured when a tram derailed after it veered off track and hit a shop in Milan.

How ragtag Taliban Air Force is raining fire deep inside PakistanThe Taliban-led Afghan military, dismissed as fragmented and under-equipped, has claimed it carried out air and drone strikes on multiple Pakistani military targets, including sites near Islamabad. This is how the ragtag military rained fire and retaliated to Pakistani strikes from the sky.

sports.headline: Delhi HC orders fresh EFI polls, IOA to form Ad-Hoc Panel The Delhi High Court has called for a revamp of the Equestrian Federation of India, calling for fresh elections. It has also asked the Indian Olympic Association to form an ad-hoc panel to oversee the functions.

Jammu and Kashmir's wait is finally over: Parvez Rasool ahead of Ranji Trophy glory Jammu and Kashmir have moved within one day of winning their maiden Ranji Trophy title, and Parvez Rasool hailed the moment as a dream turned reality for the side. A dominant performance has put them on the brink of scripting history in Indian domestic cricket.

England not obsessed with perfection in T20 World Cup: Will Jacks after NZ heroics T20 World Cup: England all-rounder Will Jacks emphasised that the side is more focused on winning than any fixation of being perfect in their campaign as they head into the semi-finals. While England's margin of victories have been tight, the side is more focused on the positives.

Nervous New Zealand will have eyes on PAK vs SL: Mitchell Santner on semi-final hopes T20 World Cup: New Zealand's semi-final hopes now hinge on Pakistan's final Super 8 result against Sri Lanka. After missing their own chance against England, the Kiwis can only wait nervously as qualification slipped out of their control.

2016 heartbreak in past, India look to return the favour to West Indies T20 World Cup, IND vs WI: Back in 2016, it was the West Indies who eliminated India with a thrilling semifinal victory. This time, India have the opportunity to turn the tables when the two teams meet in the Super 8 clash on March 1 in Kolkata.

West Indies return to hallowed Eden hoping to conjure Calypso magic vs India IND vs WI, T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8s: West Indies are set to play India in a virtual quarter-final in the T20 World Cup 2026. Despite being the favourites, India should not make the mistake of counting out the West Indies.

New Zealand stare helplessly at Pakistan vs Sri Lanka after losing to England T20 World Cup, ENG vs NZ: New Zealand no longer have their fate in their own hands, and the Pakistan vs Sri Lanka clash on Saturday in Pallekele will determine the second semi-finalist from Group 2.

MS Dhoni issued notice by Jharkhand Housing Board over misuse of residential plot Jharkhand Housing Board has issued a notice to MS Dhoni over alleged misuse of his residential plot in Ranchi. The inquiry could lead to cancellation of the plot if violations are confirmed.

Pakistan can reach T20 World Cup semis and more: Salman Mirza before Sri Lanka clash T20 World Cup, PAK vs SL: Fast bowler Salman Mirza expressed confidence that Pakistan are not only capable of reaching the semifinals but can also make a strong impact once there. Pakistan will take on Sri Lanka in their final Super 8 clash on Saturday in Pallekele.

Ravi Shastri to have stand named after him at Mumbai's Wankhede stadium Wankhede Stadium honours cricket legends as MCA names stand after Ravi Shastri and dedicates three gates to Dilip Sardesai, Diana Edulji and Eknath Solkar in tribute to Mumbai's rich heritage.

Pakistan's semi-final hopes alive math tricky but qualification possibleT20 World Cup Pakistan's semi final qualification scenario: England's four-wicket victory over New Zealand has kept Pakistan's semi-final hopes alive in the tournament. Here's the complete explanation of what Pakistan need to do to progress ahead in the event:

Pakistan stay alive for semis berth after England beat New Zealand in ColomboT20 World Cup, ENG vs NZ: England beat New Zealand by four wickets in Colombo on Saturday after chasing down 160 with three balls to spare. With England's win, Pakistan also stayed alive in the competition and will have everything to play for when they face Sri Lanka.

T20 World Cup: Rinku Singh to link-up with Indian team in Kolkata after father's last ritesT20 World Cup: Rinku Singh is set to rejoin the India camp after completing his father Khanchand Singh's last rites in Aligarh.  India are set to face the West Indies in their final Super 8s fixture in Kolkata.

Can Pakistan reach the semis? Salman Mirza stays optimistic before Sri Lanka clashT20 World Cup, PAK vs SL: Pakistan pacer Salman Mirza opened up on his team's chances of qualifying for the semi-finals. Pakistan's last Super 8 match is against Sri Lanka on February 28.

IPL 2026 likely to start on March 28, final to be played on May 31The Indian Premier League 2026 (IPL 2026) is likely to start on March 28 with the final of the competition to be played on May 31. The tournament was initially expected to get under way on March 26. However, the start date has now been pushed back by two days.

Ranji Trophy final: Auqib Nabi, Qamran Iqbal take J&K on cusp of historic triumphJammu and Kashmir finished Day 4 of the Ranji Trophy final in a strong position against Karnataka. Their dominant performance have brought them closer to their maiden title victory.

J&K on brink of maiden Ranji Trophy title as CM Omar Abdullah heads to final venueJammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Omar Abdullah is heading to Hubli as the state stands on the brink of winning their maiden Ranji Trophy title with a commanding 477-run lead over Karnataka.

ENG vs NZ Highlights Super 8: Ahmed, Jacks guide England home, keep Pakistan aliveEngland (ENG) vs New Zealand (NZ) Highlights, T20 World Cup Super 8: England have beaten New Zealand by 4 wickets and kept Pakistan alive in the semi finals race. Will Jacks and Rehan Ahmed guided England home.

Real Madrid to face Man City as UCL's R016 serves up heavyweight clashesUEFA Champions League: Real Madrid will face Manchester City in a heavyweight clash as the Champions League Round of 16 draw delivered blockbuster matchups, with PSG taking on Chelsea in another standout fixture.

India Women make horror start to post World Cup-era, lose ODI series to AustraliaINDW vs AUSW: India defeated Australia by five wickets in the second ODI on Friday to take a 2-0 lead in the three-match series. Chasing 252, Georgia Voll's 101 helped the Aussies romp home with 83 balls to spare.

Rinku Singh stands in silent grief, shoulders father's mortal remains in AligarhIndia batter Rinku Singh performed the last rites of his father Khanchand Singh, who died after a prolonged battle with liver cancer. The cricketing fraternity also expressed condolences to Rinku and his family.

Rinku Singh's father passes away, Kohli leads tributes from Indian cricket fraternityThe Indian cricket fraternity united in support of Rinku Singh after his father's passing, with Virat Kohli, Yuvraj Singh, and several other stars offering heartfelt condolences and prayers.

Smriti Mandhana, Ellyse Perry reunite in Hobart, exchange smiles, friendly chatINDW vs AUSW: Smriti Mandhana and Ellyse Perry reunited in Hobart during the second Women's ODI on Friday, February 27, at Bellerive Oval. Perry missed the earlier matches in the series after sustaining a quad injury during the T20Is.

Remember how to be fearless: How Gambhir got India batters firing again vs ZIMT20 World Cup: Tilak Varma revealed how Gautam Gambhir urged India to stick to fearless cricket before Zimbabwe clash. The message boosted confidence and played a key role in India's commanding Super 8 win.

Varun Chakravarthy will bounce back in IND vs WI: Irfan Pathan back spinnerT20 World Cup: Irfan Pathan flagged Varun Chakravarthy's recent dip as a concern but backed him to bounce back. He believes Eden Gardens could help the mystery spinner regain rhythm in India's must-win clash vs West Indies.

How did Brian Bennett tackle Jasprit Bumrah in IND vs ZIM? Zimbabwe batter revealsT20 World Cup: Zimbabwe's Brian Bennett revealed how he tackled the threat from Jasprit Bumrah during the clash against India in the Super 8 stage on Thursday, February 27. Bennett scored an impressive 97 to help Zimbabwe put on a fight against India.

Auqib Nabi for IND vs ENG? Ganguly urges selectors after Ranji final heroicsAuqib Nabi's five-wicket haul in the Ranji Trophy final has earned strong backing from Sourav Ganguly. The former India captain urged selectors to consider the J&K pacer for the England tour this summer.

Chennai's chettan can wait: Sanju Samson puts CSK buzz aside for T20 World CupT20 World Cup: Sanju Samson was thankful for the loud cheers he got in Chennai, but isn't ready to lose focus on the T20 World Cup 2026. Samson said that he is keeping the CSK excitement aside to focus on India's goal of retaining their crown.

Remembering Khanchand Singh: The father who shaped Rinku Singh's riseRinku Singh's father, Khachandra Singh, passed away during India's T20 World Cup campaign after battling stage 4 liver cancer. The man who delivered gas cylinders in Aligarh played a defining role in shaping India's calm new-age finisher.

ENG vs NZ: Pakistan hold their breath as New Zealand chase semi-final spotT20 World Cup: Pakistan will be keeping a close eye on the contest in Colombo as New Zealand and England lock horns in the Super 8 clash on Friday, February 27. A win for the Blackcaps will seal their spot and eliminate Pakistan from the tournament.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
